tutorial.title: Fretboard Overflow
tutorial.descriptionContent: Improve a website for a community of users who post guitar-related questions and leave comments for others

executableContent.instructions:
A friend of yours maintains "Fretboard Overflow," a community of users who can post guitar-related questions and leave comments for others. Your friend needs assistance in making their content more accessible to diverse users.

Let's begin by specifying a language. This lets screen readers know which language to use.

1. Give the `html` tag an attribute of `lang`.
2. The `lang` attribute should have the correct value for `english`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Fretboard Overflow

Sign up for lessons today! 50% discount expires 2 hours.

Log in | Sign up

Posted by: Brian

Total posts contributed: 183

10:19am

Does anyone know what the next major pentatonic shape is after G?

Comment by: Taylor

1:31pm

The next shape would be E. Hope that helps!

Comment by: Jaime

1:40pm

Taylor your comment helped me out as well!

©2022 All rights reserved.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's check the HTML tags to see if they are semantic. The `div` container for `

Fret Overflow

` is generic and provides no context. Choosing a meaningful HTML tag here lets the screen reader know this is the page header. 1. Change the generic `div` container to the appropriate HTML tag.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
The following `div` container for `Sign up for lessons today! 50% discount expires in 2 hours` has some information that is very important and urgent for users to realize! Help the screen readers access this information.
1. Give the `div` tag that contains `Sign up for lessons today! 50% discount expires in 2 hours`  a `role` attribute.
2. The `role` attribute should have the correct value.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
There are two images below the navigation menu that aren't related to the menu. Let's properly introduce them with a title. Recall that an `h1` element already exists, so make sure to include the correct one.
1. Add the correct heading tag.
2. Add `Guitar Spotlight` within the heading tag.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Sometimes it's efficient and time-saving for screen readers to identify a single container for several images that don't provide more context than just one would do.  It's also appealing for other content such as text, emojis, and code snippets.
1. Include the correct attribute in the `div` container of both images.
2. Give the attribute the correct value.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's get into the practice of including a helpful `img` attribute that holds the alternative text for an image. Alternative texts can be helpful when an image is not available to the user.
1. Give each `img` tag the correct attribute.
2. Make sure the `value` is an empty string because in this case, the images are just decorative.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
We want to provide only relevant content to screen readers. Fretboard Overflow has a section for users to ask and resolve their questions. However, knowing someone's total contributions isn't helpful in this case and can have screen readers read long numbers, which is unnecessary.
1. Include the correct attribute to **only** hide `Total posts contributed: 183` from assistive technologies. This information is not the main focus on Fretboard Overflow!

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Taylor and Jaime shared their opinions with Brian. Visually, we acknowledge these as comments. Let's use a `role` attribute to let assistive technologies know as well.
1. Include the correct attribute for both comments.
2. Include the correct values for each attribute.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Fretboard Overflow has a footer at the bottom of the website. Your friend insists that the tag itself should not change for the time being, so we'll need to make sure generic containers become meaningful. The `div` container is not providing any meaningful context to screen readers. Let's fix that!
1. Include the correct attribute for the `div` container.
2. Include the correct value that indicates the `div` container is a footer.
